string.text: What's your business here, buddy?
Well, you know, just drifting around...
This ain't the place for you to be driftin', little napkin.
I'm going, I'm going.
Screw you!
Crutch sent me. I came to collect a package from your boss.
Ah, I see. Cough up the dough and we'll let you in.
What dough? The trader didn't tell me anything about that.
Well, I'm telling you. Hand over the paper and we'll let you in. If you ain't paying, take the detour. Your choice.
Where's the detour?
Up to you to find out. Ain't my problem.
Alright. I'll find the detour, but as soon as I get inside the base, your papa's gonna know you're hustling bribes.
Listen, man, why don't you just cut the righteous talk and head on in? We ain't gonna touch you. Unless you make another threat, that is.
I see. I'll head on in.
What do you need?
Hi. Crutch sent me. I'm here for the package.
Fresh meat, huh? Then listen up: this here is our base, and that means you're a guest to us. Remember that, and don't be making a show. Understand?
I understand. I'll just grab the case and hit the road.
Hand over the money.
Here.
I don't have enough. I'll be right back.
Alright, you can get out of here. And please, try not to overstay your welcome.
Got it. I'm leaving.
Got the money?
What're ya hanging 'round for?
Just passing by. I'm leaving.
Say, pal, are you afraid of something?
What do you mean?
Just look at your legs. They're practically shaking! Try to make it to the can before you drop one on the ground, hah! Why so tense, buddy? You think our crew is gonna make trouble for you here?
To be honest? I think it's best to be careful around you.
Well, you're right about that, but no worries. I take it you're gonna be hauling packages from the Garbage trader?
For now, yes.
I see. So, uh... I'm gathering a team for a job. If the trader trusted you with his business, and you know when to play it safe, it means you're a stalker with brains. Interested?
What job? Raids, muggings, robberies?
Hey, don't be comparing us to those junkyard gangbangers! They're half loony and half desperate. People from 'round here... you could say we're more sympathetic.
So what's this job of yours?
I'm gathering a group to scout a place. This ain't no child's play, or else wouldn't need more than one or two guys.
What place?
You know the abandoned factory nearby?
Haven't heard.
Yeah, I passed by it.

Well, basically, it's close by. That's also where you have the entrance to lab X18. We used to have it under control, squeezed all sorts of stalkers that enjoyed wandering into abandoned labs. Earned us some cash on the side. Later, some real shit went down in that place. Contacted our boys, asked what's up — no response. So we thought, maybe that last emission screwed up our comms. Sent a couple boys to check it out.\n \nThey come back after an hour, all panting and scared shitless. I ask, "What's the matter? What the hell happened?" And then they tell me, "Our boys are on ropes! They're all dead!" I ask, "The hell are you on? What do you mean, 'they're on ropes'"?

Good. You probably know that's where the entrance to lab X18 is at. We used to have it under control, squeezed all sorts of stalkers that enjoyed wandering into abandoned labs. Earned us some cash on the side. Later, some real shit went down in that place. Contacted our boys, asked what's up — no response. So we thought, maybe that last emission screwed up our comms. Sent a couple boys to check it out.\n \nThey come back after an hour, all panting and scared shitless. I ask, "What's the matter? What the hell happened?" And then they tell me, "Our boys are on ropes! They're all dead!" I ask, "The hell are you on? What do you mean, 'they're on ropes'"?
What did they say?

Well, they caught their breath and started telling me everything. They were at the factory, and it was dead silent, until they started getting hit with the smell. Went inside and found all our boys dead with their remains scattered all over. Some were hanging on beams below the roof, others on the walls... It's like someone took them and hung them like Christmas lights. I didn't believe them for a moment, so I went there myself. Didn't get too close, just went up to the gate — and yeah, they weren't shitting.\n \nI had no clue how things ended up as they did, but I thought I'd round up the boys and go scout the place. I come back, and no one wants to go with me. The rumor spread like wildfire, and that place ended up on our blacklist — under no circumstances does anyone want to go there.
Damn... So did you manage to gather a team?
Three men. If you're in on it, we'll get going.
What's in it for me?
I'll pay you. Got four grand. I'll throw in some more if any trouble comes our way.
Alright, that'll do. When are we moving out?
I've got my boys near the factory. We'll go there, group together and head inside.
Got it. Let's go.
At this very moment? I've got some business to take care of. You go and I'll catch up.
Hey, where the hell have you been? We're fed up sitting on our asses.
I'm ready. Let's go.
Just a little longer.
Just a walk in the park, huh? Jesus...
God damn! Just what in the hell was that?!
Damned if I know! Didn't look like a regular old poltergeist at all — it's even got a different shine and color. Where did it even come from?
You did say there's an underground entrance here. That's got to be it.
Dunno, but it's a better guess than mine.
I hope doesn't have any offspring.
Best we make sure of that. I can't do business if we're gonna have garbage like this residing next door.
Let's just blow up the underground passage and be done with it.
Then why the hell did we clean this place up in the first place? We collapse the passage and no one's gonna visit here anymore. That means we can kiss our profit goodbye.

I don't think the underground's what stalkers are looking for. What else could we find there of interest? My pal told me X18 was discovered just a few years ago — it must've been ransacked since then.

No offense, homeboy, but I took you for someone who's seen the Zone. That's some stupid questions right there. It's not just an underground vault but an abandoned laboratory. You might think the place is raided, but I'm telling you: there's tons of good stuff left.\n \nYou ever heard the story about those valuable underground artifacts? It's more than just a story, if you ask me. We had this one stalker who liked going underground — paid us big money but still came time and time again. That means he made a profit, right? Though, he didn't return from his last underground trip... probably buried down there with all that loot he liked carrying.
In any case, that's none of my business. I did my part, right?
I keep my word. Honest pay for honest work. In case you're interested, don't be a stranger — we'll always have work in store for ya.
Thanks. Good luck with your business, then!
You too! Just a friendly piece of advice as thanks for your help: if you're gonna continue dealing with Mongol, think twice before making any rash decisions. Watch yourself around him.
What do you mean?
Simple. Screwing over stalkers like you is a piece of cake for him.
Thanks for the heads-up. Stay safe.
Opa! Our mutie butcher! What'll it be?
Welcome. What do you need?
Anything new?
Nothing yet.
Don't take too long. Grab the pot and stick it in the punks' meals.
I'm going.
I got info on the entrance, but I'll go check it first.
What is this? There are no artifacts in your case!
What? What's wrong?
I gave you the money — the trader's money — and you didn't fulfill your part of the bargain. There are no artifacts in the case.

You've gone soft in the head, punk. You were given the case; whether you brought the artifacts to the trader or not is your problem. Where were you the whole time? Things like that need to be checked first thing, you snowflake... but you just went and wasted them all, and now you're making accusations against me. You know, it's too bad I need to maintain good relations with the trader, or else neither he nor any other stalker would recognize you after you leave here. Take a hike!
But I need those artifacts.
No problem at all. Fifty grand and we'll have them ready for you.
I see how it is...
Whatcha need, stalker boy?
Hey. It's me again. Still got work to offer me?
Of course I do. We've got plans for this place, so there's a lot to be done. Hey, aren't you supposed to be at the Garbage?
Put short, you were right about Mongol. So I wouldn't mind some work.

Yeah, he can go shove a grenade up his ass. Here's a little secret: we want to get rid of him, 'cause we're real fed up... but it needs to be done peacefully. Mongol's got a lot of supporters — say something out of place and they'll pounce on you faster than a pack of snorks. But that's just thinkin' aloud. We should get down to business.
Let's make this clear: I'm not gonna do hits or cross free stalkers.

That's not what I'm suggesting. We'll do it ourselves if we have to. There's other work for you too — get in on our business. Perhaps you won't be raking in cash, but you won't be strapped for it either.
An interesting offer... but what am I signing up for?

First, we need to solve our little problem and check whether those muties have a lair underground. I'll send two of my boys with you as backup. Here's the key to the entrance. Just assess the situation, and if you see anything that looks like the mutant, scram on out of there — I don't want more casualties. While you do that, we'll finish up work here on the surface.
Alright. If it's just a scouting trip, I'm in.
Get to the lab!
On it.
There you are! I was worried sick about you guys. What did you find?
Came across a mutant similar to the other one. We dealt with it.
Just one? Hey, where are my boys?
I ran into a Freedomer... No idea how he ended up there, but he fired at us on sight.
How's Freedom fit into all this? We were here this whole time — didn't let anyone through! Just what the hell happened down there?
If you don't believe me, I found this PDA on his body. It says something about a back entrance.
Strange... I don't know of any other entrance.

Still, he somehow found a way in... Guy was armed to the teeth. He was looking for a map of stashes, and it seems that wealthy stalker of yours was doing the same thing — I found his body. Now I see why he went into the underground so often.
What map?
Take a look yourself — I found it on the stalker. It's got the location of some Freedom stash that was left while they were still in the Dark Valley.
Strange. Haven't heard anything about it, and it's right under our base. I doubt even Mongol knows about it. What about my boys — did they make it?
We split up. By the time I came back, the Freedom guy was searching their bodies.
Damn, that's a real shame. Regardless, you did good: you dealt with the mutant and dug up some very interesting info. If you're interested, my offer still stands: you wanna join up with our crew?
I'll have to refuse. Don't take this as an insult, but I'd rather not be part of the bandit roster.
That's cool. I'm not forcing you. I'm just suggesting we continue cooperating. Honest pay for honest work, if we get any... and you won't be doing any hits either.
Well, hell. I'm staying in the Dark Valley for a couple days, so I could use the extra work. I'm in.

Sweet! Right now, we need to know as much as possible about the secret lab entrance the Freedom guy found. If we don't have it sealed and someone else finds out about it, our business is going down the drain.
Any thoughts?

I have one. Some stalkers settled on the farm, and they've been here longer than us, so they know the area better. Maybe they know some kind of lead? You're a guy with a pretty good reputation on you — best you go talk to them.
Alright. I'll drop by.

Hey, want a cool gun? I cracked open someone's stash at Yantar and found this Gauss rifle — practically new. I'm giving it away for only 1500 rubles! Don't have any rounds for it, but I need the cash real bad.
Seems a bit shady to me... I'll have to decline the offer. But I do have a few questions for you.
I'll answer any questions as long as you buy the gun.
Give it up. What are you trying to sell me?
Nah, pal, you give up your money. Pay up and we'll talk.
Fine. Take the damn money, you hustler.
Damn. Out of cash right now...
Now we're talking. What did you want?
Come back when you get some. Best you don't talk to the others without any cash — I'll tell 'em.
I'm looking for info on a secret entrance to lab X18. I know there's one somewhere.
Bye.
Why you wanna know that, man?
The bandits are robbing me blind! I want to find another way around so I can have a chance at some loot.
There's nothing there but trash. What exactly did you plan on finding?
I'm looking for old tech. One man's trash is another man's treasure.
Yeah, that makes sense... but I don't know of any such entrance. First time I've heard of it.
You're a real fraud, you know that? Paid you for jack shit. You'll get far like that!
Don't get so worked up, pal. Ask Clumsy by the fire over there — he'll have more to tell you.
Got it.
So, got the cash?
Here.
Not yet.
Whatcha want? Out of my sight, man.
Go about your business. Stay out of the way.
What are ya hanging 'round here for? Clear out.
I'm listening.
Speak.
What is it?
Someone's on edge today.
Hi. Are you Clumsy? I was told you could help me with something.
That's me. What is it?
I'm looking for a secret entrance to lab X18. Those bastard bandits are taking all of my money. Going through them is unprofitable.

Sorry, but I can't help you for free either. Sharing information for free in these times is a luxury that you can't afford — *we* can't afford. Lots of bandits around, and they've cleared our pockets too.
What do you want in exchange for information? I already paid for your "Gauss rifle."
Money's not what I need. There's something else you could help with instead... You look like you've been in the Zone for a while; you'll manage this.
What needs doing?

There's a Fault anomaly a couple hundred yards away. I noticed this interesting artifact around it but couldn't get it. Tried to grab it, but it just wouldn't let me... and then my head started hurting, so I left. Strange place, for sure — I haven't noticed anything like that before. Perhaps you'll have better luck?
I do have some experience with artifact catching. I'll go check it out... but if you don't hand me the info, I'll keep it for myself.
How's it going with the artifact?
Don't have it yet.
What took you so long? Got the artifact?
Here it is. Haven't seen anything this weird before...
Woah, look at it... The hell is this? And what the hell happened to you? Did you stain your pants or something?
When I tried grabbing the artifact, it moved away a few meters from me. Then I started seeing phantom stalkers, and at the end of it, I was attacked by mutants resembling controllers...
Looks like I was right about something being off there. What happened next?
When I dealt with the mutants, my eyes were all foggy and I woke up in the morning. All that stuff was gone. I only saw the artifact lying in front of me...

Wow... Last time I went there, my head started aching. I pretty much came to myself after a couple hours. Anyway, as we agreed, I'll send you the approximate coordinates to the entrance on your PDA. Be careful there — there's tons more mutants waiting for you.
Thanks. Bye.
Finally!
What happened?
We did some thinking on the map you found of the Freedom stash, and we've come up with a plan on how to clean it out quietly.
What do you mean "clean it out"? What about Mongol? I thought you'd tell your leader that there are supplies under the base and that you'd get them afterwards.
We split with him. We're running our own gang now.
Well, now... Won't there be consequences for that?
Doubt it. We brought some of the other boys with us, so our camp isn't falling that easily, even if Mongol's planning on it... but he won't do anything. I'm sure of it.
But how do you plan on cleaning out the stash without making any fuss or taking anyone out? There are at least two dozen people in that base!
We'll get creative. And you're gonna help us with that.
Why me?
Because, all things considered, you're working with Mongol's group. They don't see you as an outsider in their base, and I can't say the same about us after leaving there.
What's your plan, then?

Okay, listen up. We know this one scientist who's willing to sell us some dope. We'll use it to drug the whole camp and, while they're all out like a light, clean out the stash. How's that sound to you? Genius plan, ain't it?
It's doubtful. How do you plan on carrying all that out?

Simple. I spent a long time in that base, so I know it like the back of my hand. You could spread it out inside the field kitchen: they'll go get their chow and then hit the sack. Whoever refuses dinner gets a pistol whip to the face — simple as that. No one will even realize who fooled 'em. I'll also give you a sizable reward for it — have I ever let you down on that?
You haven't... At least I've made enough for some equipment. What do I need to do?
You meet with the scientist, buy the dope and run inside the base. Then quietly spread out the powder, and that's that. We'll take care of the rest.

I'm in — I've got my bone to pick with them. I'll set down my conditions, though: I'm not gonna call dibs on the Freedom stash. I just need one thing held by Mongol. Help me get it and I'll come with you.

I didn't doubt you for a second! We'll stick out for you too, of course. You'll get your thing... Now, business: right now, I'm gonna prepare the boys and brief 'em on everything. In the meantime, you go to the scientist — just so happens he's on official business in the Valley. Here's your dough — buy the dope with it. After that, you go inside the base, and once you're there, be extra careful so that not a single rat catches you slip anything. Soon as they're sound asleep, we go inside and clean out the stash, nice and quiet. Everything clear?
Clear! I'm off.
Yes?
Hello! I'm here for the goods. You must've been told in advance.
Oh, hello! Yes, I've been notified of your arrival. Here is your package.
Is this your security?
Naturally. Without a security detail, our facility's assistants never leave anywhere.
What are you doing so far away from your base? It's at Agroprom, correct?

Correct. There are certain samples we have to take in as short amount of time as possible... and, as ill fortune would have it, our superiors have no hired stalkers at their disposal. In such cases, such work is left to us. Personally, though, I adore expeditions of this type... there are simply times when laboratory work needs to be cast aside. Granted, the task I have today is not a simple one.
What's the matter?
A unique anomaly has formed here. This type appears very rarely, and thus we'd like to study it in detail.
Looks like an ordinary Electro.

There are many of them here. What confuses me is that it's formed next to the swamp, next to a chemical anomaly. I'm interested in how they interact with one another. Perhaps some new artifacts will appear in the process. I need to place a scanner as close as possible to the epicenter, but it's not letting me.
No way it can be placed from behind?
There is... but that may cause the final data to become of questionable quality.
Let me try, okay? I heard Electros can be discharged by throwing bolts into them. Something might come out of it.
I see. Well, good luck to you then — I have to get back to my business.
That would be greatly appreciated.
I'll try.
Greetings.
Yes?
Good day.
Until next time.
How is it going?
Just a minute.
I see you made it!
I suppose. It wasn't easy. Did I place the scanner correctly?

As correct as can be! Thank you for the help. Incidentally, I cannot pay you anything right now, but do come visit me in our facility. Next week, I'll be working in the vegetation research department. There will absolutely be work for you... that pays well, of course.
Garden work?
Haha! I don't believe a stalker of your stature would work with a shovel. We'll find more suitable work for you.
Thank you. Until next time.
What are you doing here?
I'm just working for the trader from the Garbage. I came here for the package.
I got that... but what are you snooping around the whole base for? Trying to sniff out somethin'?
Well... How do I explain it? I'm tight on money right now, and I need a bite real bad. I saw your kitchen, and it smells like heaven, so I wanted to grab something.
Hahaha! You're a sneaky bastard, you know that? Okay, come back in an hour. We'll feed ya for sure, you bum. Until then, just stay out of our hair.
What's for dinner?
You'll see. Now, scram on out of here.
Later, then.
What's the news?
The deed's done.
That fast? Way to go! Everything go smooth?
I think so.
What do you mean, "I think so"? You sure everything's okay?
One of the bandits noticed me, but he didn't see when I slipped the powder.
Okay, great. That's all that matters. Now, we'll make a move for the stash in approximately two hours. I have a lookout at the gas station — soon as he gives the signal, we'll move.
Got the explosives?
Guess what: we know how to get the door open, so we won't have to use up the explosives on that. We could put the charge to different use instead.
For what?

What do you mean, "for what"? You were looking for another entrance to the lab, remember? Wouldn't be a bad thing if we'd seal it, considering that word in the Zone travels fast. Soon enough, everyone and their pseudodog will know about it. I'll entrust the job to you while we still have time. Here's the charge — blow everything up nice and firm. As soon as we need help, I'll holler at ya.
Alright. I'm off.
We're all set.
Well? Everything prepared?
Look at 'em, all sleeping like babies! Whoever hasn't fallen asleep, well, that's their problem. Careful: we don't have much time, so let's make this lightning fast. Right, let's go!
Let's go.
Right! While we deal with the door, you go look for the thing you need. It's safer if my pal goes with you. Once you have it, get back here on the double. Got it?
Got it. I'm moving.

Hold up! Recently, a bunch of these lowlifes locked up a stalker in the basement. Think they called him "Mute." I might be a bandit myself, but man, some things you just don't do... I dunno what they're gonna do with him, but go check it out on the way if you get the chance. Might even free him. Just don't take too long — time's short as it is!
Yeah, I definitely don't want to leave a stalker brother here. I should try. I'm off.
Already taken care of, so don't worry. I'm off.
Hey, man. Feel like shooting some crows?
Sure.
Great. You can play for fun, cash, or try to set a new record. What do you want to do?
Nah, I don't feel like it.
Your choice, buddy. I'll be here if you change your mind.
Here's your dough as promised. I play fair. How about another go?
That was just bad luck. Give it another shot, man!
Where are you going, man? Shooting outside is your private business, but how about you stay and play by the rules?
You know that your time is ticking, right? We can talk later.
Got it.
I want to play for money.
That's music to my ears. You need me to run over the rules for you or what?
Let's get shooting.
Enough chat, buddy. So, how many crows do you reckon you can take down in one minute?
Deal.
Kickass. Get your shooter ready, man.
Okay.
I don't have that much cash.
Then how about you choose something you can afford?
Yeah, I'll choose a different number of crows.
No, not interested.
Well, you can play for fun. Or you could try to set a record, but that really hits your pocket. What do you say?
Please explain.

Playing for money is my definition of fun. Tell me how many crows you're gonna take down in a minute, bet your cash and go get 'em. If you kill as many as you said, I double your cash, fair and square. If you don't, I keep the bet. And remember, the more crows, the higher the bets.
I don't feel like playing all of a sudden.
Are there any general rules?

Not really. I start the timer, you get ready and start blasting at the crows on my signal. If you kill the right number in a minute, you win — good job and all that. How you kill them is up to you. But remember: if you leave this area, the game is over. So, do you want to play for fun, money, or try and set a new record?
I don't feel like playing.
Your choice, buddy. I'll be here if you change your mind.
I want to set a new record.
Let's start.
Okay.
Okay. Let's see if you're champion material, buddy.
I'd like to, but I don't have the cash.
Well, there are simpler options: you can play for cash or just for fun. What do you say?
I... changed my mind.
Remind me what the rules are.

Well, this one is for the real men. If you reckon you can beat the current record, you make a bet that matches it. If you manage to set a new record, I'll double your bet — plus, you'll be the new champ and all that. If you don't, I keep your cash.
I... changed my mind.
For fun.
Ahh, just practicing? You remember the rules, don't ya?
Yeah. Let's get to the shooting.
Okay, so how many crows can you take out?
Okay, well, cough up the cash.
Okay.
No. Tell me.

Well, playing for fun is just that — you won't get any cash. It's good if you want to practice or just feeling shitty and want to shoot something. You just decide how many crows you can take out in a minute and attempt to do just that.
I changed my mind.
No problem. The choices are still the same: play for money or try for a record. What do you say?
You did some good shootin' there, buddy. You should think about playing for cash. Feel like shooting some more?
Check it out, man! One shot from this vertical baby and feathers fill the air!
Hrm... I better go now.
You don't like fowl either, heh? Don't worry, we got loads of 'em here!
Whatcha standing there for? C'mon, slaughter the damn things, make a bloody mess, go for it!
Tell me about yourself.

I was doing backstreet business back in the Soviet Union when I got caught on a major deal. I did my time like a man — made some good buddies and connections with the underworld crowd — and when I got out, I started buying up goods from burglars. I got nicked again and did some more time, but when I got out, the Soviet Union was dead and buried. I never managed to adjust to the changes — I was broke and living a shit life... but then the Zone appeared, and I bolted here right away. This place immediately reminded me of the good old days, so I became a trader without a second thought. At first, I hung out with the boys at the Garbage, then made my way here. Been through two bosses by now! Mongol reminds me of Yoga — a sneaky bastard, that one. My gut tells me he'll end up the same way as my first boss.
Thanks.
Listen, punk, you better clear out of here! I won't be held responsible for letting in drifters like you. Take the front entrance.
Wrong entrance, buddy. Go through the front one so I don't get any trouble for trash like you.
Hit the bricks, you bum! If it's the boss you want, go through the main entrance. This one is for our boys exclusively.
Best you clear out of here, pal, before I wipe you off the face of the Zone myself. If it's the boss you want, take the main entrance.
You stalkers amaze me! The hell you lookin' for here? Take the main entrance — this one ain't open for riffraff like you!
Don't get worked up. I'm leaving.
I'm gone.
I'm leaving.
Alright, I'm going.
I get it. Easy.
Listen, party crasher, what are you slithering around for? If it's the boss you want to see, you need to go through the other side. This here is for our top dogs only, capiche?
Buddy, hit the road while you still can! Go inside our territory through the main entrance... if they let you through, that is.
Turn around and go back to where you came, stalker boy. If you want Mongol, go through the other side. We don't let strangers through here.
What are you looking at? Go see the boss if you have questions — it's on the other side. Now piss off!

Get lost, stalker — I ain't got time for you. If you've got business with Mongol, you can only get inside from the other side, where the gas station's at... if our boys don't take every red cent from you, hehe!
I won't bother you.
Just don't get worked up. I'm turning.
Alright, alright. I'm leaving.
Yep, I'm getting out of here.
You have a good day.
Hey, party crasher! Turn back around and beat it while you still have the chance! Looking for Mongol? Then it's further to the right, through the main entrance. We don't let strangers pass here.
Buddy, you should probably hightail it away from here... or something bad might happen to you. If you need the boss that badly, strike a deal with the boys at the front entrance. Capice?
Hey, ambassador, take whatever diplomatic business you have and go through the main entrance. Just don't waste my time, 'kay?
Hanging around here like a stray dog, huh? It's the boss you want, isn't it? Then take the front entrance. Take it up with boys over there, not with me. Get lost.

What is it you don't get, stalker? Not the best place for you to hang around all alone, I'm telling you. If you wanna see Mongol, see the boys at the main entrance. Who knows, they might let you in if they're in a good mood... Now, clear off while you still can.
I'm turning.
Consider me gone.
Right. I'm leaving.
I'm out of here. Dial it down.
Yep, I'm out of here.
Hold your horses, punk! You're here for the boss, ain't you? Then you'll just have to pay him some tribute!
That wasn't the deal. I came to get the artifacts for the trader.
No, just wandering around. I'm off.

We don't care about your deals right now. Our boys are preparing for a raid across fields that are radioactive, but we're short on antirads. If you can get us ten of those, you can get your piece-of-shit artifacts. We'll keep our word.
Here are your antirads.
I'm short on antirads myself...
See? Where there's a hill... I mean, will, there's a way! Go on inside — I'll warn the others so they don't do anything to ya. Now hurry, chop-chop!

Well... I'll give you one other option. Either you pay up in cash instead of antirads — four grand — or you get us an artifact that can draw out radiation. You could also try to get a hold of antirads. The locals in uniform know more about it, but we're at odds with 'em.
I'll go, then.
Fine... Here are your antirads.
Take the money.
Here's an artifact.
Alright. I'll see what I can think of...
Someone's eager to go places today! Where you headed, jag-off? To the boss? Uh-uh, pal, no chance — you'll have to do a little something for us first.
Hey, that wasn't the deal. I just need to get the artifacts.
I'm just looking around. Consider me gone.

We don't give two turds in a pseudodog sandwich about your deals. Get us ten pieces of antirad and we'll talk. A group of ours is goin' on a raid in a couple of days — those areas are radioactive, and we don't have enough meds against it. Get it for us and you can pick up your artifacts.
Here are the antirads.
I'm low on meds myself...
Look at that! Funny you were so hesitant to cough it up! Okay, go on in. I'll tell our boys not to touch you.

I guess there are a couple other options for you. Either you hand us money instead of antirads — four figures — or you get us some artifact that can deal with the radiation. 'Course, it's better if you get a hold of antirads. The locals in uniform probably have a supply, though we're at odds with 'em.
Thanks.
Alright. Here are the antirads.
Take the cash.
Take this artifact.
Alright. I'll try to think of something.
Did you get what was asked of you?
So, find antirads?
Not yet...
A stalker! No way... One of my own!
Hey, who are you and how'd you end up here?

Name's Mute. Those bastard bandits put heat on me practically right by the Duty checkpoint in front of the Bar! Plain embarrassing how those scum with jackets full of holes could shake down an experienced stalker... Those sons of bitches took everything. Only got this stupid sweater, and god knows where my precious armor's at... Now I'm in this cell, wasting away like a rotten corpse.
So you're Mute, guy who disappeared from Brute's group? Your boys are looking for you!
Yeah... Shit like that happens... You been here for long?
Well, I'll be! What a small world! Yeah, I'm from his group, but we'll talk about that later. Could you help me out? I've been down here for three weeks by now!
I've been down in this damp basement for three weeks by now. Help me out, stalker!
I don't even know how to help you. The bandits don't exactly trust me...
Think of something, please! There's only one of those shitbags upstairs.
Getting out from there won't be that easy. I'll try to help when I get the chance. You have my word.
Right now, everyone should be sound asleep thanks to an elaborate scheme of mine... Wait just a moment. I'll try getting you out.
Get lost before I throw you in the cell with that prick!
Alright, alright. I'm leaving.
Open the cell, stalker! The controls are on the wall.
Stalker, get me out of here.
Buddy, please, open this damn cell!
Don't panic. I'm on it.
Wait up. I'll open it now.
Wait up.
Man, thank you so much! If it wasn't for you...
Congratulations on reclaiming your freedom!
If only you knew what escape plans I've been cooking up... I thought to myself, this is the end — I'm gonna die in this stinking cell and no one will even remember me. And then you show up!
Let's get out of here, man. You have any place you could go without equipment?
So that's who you are, Mute the Duty guy! Your squadmates are looking for you — I saw them at the Cordon. Brute's group, right?

Of course I do! I'm going to the Bar, to my group — to Brute and the others. Feels like forever since I last saw them... I'll just go to the Cordon along the way to do some business — won't be getting through the bandits to take a direct path anyway.

Well, I should realize it's a small world by now... Yeah, that's my group. So they're at the Cordon? They must've gone to the Bar by now, so I'll make my way there. I'll just go to the Cordon along the way to do some business — won't be getting through the bandits to take a direct path anyway.
I feel you. I've been in situations like this too, but not to this extent.
So just how did you end up here?

Listen, drop by at the Bar when you get the chance — my boys and I are usually stationed at the Duty checkpoint by the Wild Territory. I've got this stash that's jam packed with stuff, so I'll give you some of it to remember me. Drop by if you're ever around. My guys will also be glad to see you!

Yeah, so, I was heading in the direction of the Army Warehouses. Was almost at the Duty checkpoint by the Bar when those bastard bandits put heat on me. Plain embarrassing how I couldn't deal with them... Let's just forget about it.\n \nListen, drop by at the Bar when you get the chance — my boys and I are usually stationed at the Duty checkpoint by the Wild Territory. I've got this stash that's jam packed with stuff, so I'll give you some of it to remember me. Drop by if you're ever around. My guys will also be glad to see you!
I'll be sure to visit.
Hold up. How'd you even get here? What's happening up there, where are the bandits?
Long story. Look, the bandits are out like logs, so you need to disappear before they wake up.
Alright. Stay safe! See you at the Bar.
See you.
Hi. Got the goods?
Hey. You guys sure seem on edge. I don't have the goods, but I have this PDA.
What else did you find there? I mean, in the place where you found the PDA.
Some corpses... Seems like there was a battle there. A few mutants, stalkers and mercenaries. It's like they first shot at the mutants and then at each other.
That makes sense... Actually, no, it doesn't. There are no goods, but there's you and a load of corpses. How did you even end up in there?
The boys sent a distress signal, so Crutch sent me.
Idiots! Alright, savior boy, here's a little something for the PDA.
Thank you, gracious sir.

Cut the wise talk, stalker. I need those goods ASAP; you probably have an empty wallet and nothing to do, and I have no time to look for someone else. Listen: here's a spare meeting place in case of any unforeseen circumstances. That's where the column was supposed to move in case there were any misunderstandings. You go with my man — he'll cover you. Go there, look around, then report back.
Got it. Why don't you take your henchmen and go by yourself?
Because, smartass, I need to remain here in case that part of the group decides to come back here. Now, enough chit-chat. Grinya will go with you.
Seems I have no choice. I'll move out with him.
Sorry, stalker, but I have specific instructions regarding you.
So that's how it is. Why'd we go all the way here? Was killing me on the spot no good? Wasted time.
How was it wasted time? I already checked that the camp was empty. I only needed you to check the anomalies for me.
Bastards!
What are you staring at? Come on, get up. I'd even say you owe me a thank-you, hehe!
Thanks... And who are you?
Who am I... A bat in a freakin' hat. Name's Cluster.
Cluster... What clusterfuck have I gotten myself into? How'd you get here?

You're asking big questions, pal! What's your name? Investigator? Just so you know, I'm a goodfella and I don't like watching things go south. I see a man in trouble, I help him. I mean, it'll go in my favor, right?
For someone in bandit cloth, never once have I met a goody two-shoes like you.
That's just pushing it, buddy! I'm telling you, Cluster's a good guy, don't like when there's trouble. He ain't the sharpest tool in the shed, but he's no chump either, you get me?
I get you, I get you. Though, forgive me if I don't believe in good samaritans among your people.
Ah, fugget about it. Believe in Santa Claus if you like, but don't forget Cluster saved your hide. As you understand, he hopes the, uh... service will be returned.
I'm not surprised. What do you need?

Okay, so, whacking Vizier is a no-go right now, 'specially since we don't know who's covering up for him. We can't stay here either, 'cos they'll be coming for your escort soon. All I can say is, you're in their sights now!
I get that, but what are you getting out of this, Cluster? They'll waste both of us.

Well, you see here: I saw what was in the place where the stalkers carried their box, and since Vizier himself is in the game, there must be some serious goodies in that box. I can feel it. These guys really don't want show their cards, since they tried to off ya. Y'know, less people knowing about it means less trouble for them, and the head honcho gets more dough.
I didn't even want anything out of this whole thing ???. What exactly do you suggest?
We need to find that box and take the stuff no matter what. I can't do it on my own, so you'll help me in return. I also know some people, so when we find it, we'll take off and see them. Capiche?
Capiche. Where are we headed?

To the Garbage. I stashed a PDA I found on a stalker there before you showed up. I got a small stash there and I need to read what's in the PDA, 'cos doing it in the Valley with this whole circus? Not a chance.
Let's go.
Tell me about yourself.
Heh, buddy, if I tell you anything, it's game over for me!
Holy shit, you scared me!
Hi. One question: who are you and what's happening here?

Phew, heart's beating out of my chest. Nice to see you too, traveler. I'm trying to make this little device, but I'm missing one part... a few parts, actually. Name's Harpoon. Listen, could you help me? There's good pay in it for you.
Of course I can help, but what is it you're making?
A radio receiver. I should say, something like a radio receiver, but more powerful. For that, I need an actual radio, plus as an electric lamp.
What's the lamp for?
You see, to amplify the signal, I need some source of electricity. See how much equipment there is here? I plan on making a generator out of it, and for that, I need a lamp.
Okay, then. So what's the catch? You said you'd pay me well.

There is one catch. I know places where you can get all the stuff: there's a lamp, as well as a radio, in the garage next to the entrance to the abandoned laboratory. There's bound to be lots of garbage and old electronics there. It's just that I already sent one guy there, and he hasn't come back. Maybe he gave up on it, or maybe... maybe something happened to him.
Okay, I'll try to solve your problem, but no guarantees.
Find anything?
How's it going?
Any luck?
Nothing yet.
Haven't found anything.
If I get any results, I'll let you know.
Hey there, newcomer. Need something?
Hi. Yeah, I'd like to know: who are you?
That's an unusual, if not stupid question. We're a group of stalkers who live here, doing the usual things, collecting artifacts and making a living. Just like everyone else. My name's Mug.
I see. Who exactly is that Harpoon guy?
Well, he's been with us since the beginning. Decent guy, just a bit secretive. He's kind of our engineer.
So, this "secrecy" led him to leave separately from you?
Not really. He concluded that we'd distract him, which is why he's the only true loner out of us.
And he's always been with you?
No. There was this one faction long ago, though I forgot the name. They were doing research. When it split up, he happened upon us. That's pretty much all we know about him.
I see. I guess I'll go.
You got everything? Are you in one piece? What happened to the other guy?
Here's your junk. You don't need to look for him — he's doing fine where he is, all eaten up by bloodsuckers. And I still have a question for you.
Shoot. Oh, yeah, your reward: here's the money. It'll be of use to you.
Thanks. As for my question: why so much money for a regular fetch job?

First of all, I told you the pay would be good. Second: you got me. I don't need the lamp for a radio receiver — I'm a collectioner of sorts, gathering all kinds of equipment and other thingies. This, for example, is a rare sample.
I see. Not my business anymore. You got anything else you need dug up?
It's money you want, huh? I get it. Let me think... I do have something, but I'm not ready to share with you just yet.
Is it a secret?
You could say that. Come back here later when I finish a little business. I'll message you.
Alright. You've got me interested.
Trust me, it'll be worth it.
Later.
Ah, it's you. I can explain...
Don't play stupid. Puma already did.
I wasn't trying to.
Who are you really, and what happened at the farm? I know you're no collectioner.
Correct. I take it I'm dead if I don't tell you?
You're goddamn right.

My story starts with the Clear Sky faction. I was a fighter in their ranks, fond of all sorts of technical devices. I learned from the technician Novikov... doubt you know who that is. Anyway, I once overheard a little conversation between our commander-in-chief and an apprentice, and it was something about "psy-emissions," the "C-Consciousness" and "Strelok." As it turned out, our chief had worked in the C-Consciousness, and the rumor spread after the faction broke apart. At one point, I thought: why not make my own pocket psy-emitter? Imagine what a weapon that would be. That's when the stalkers invited me, and after thinking about it, I joined. Then we settled here, and I realized this was the perfect spot... and today, I've made history. I don't mind continuing the work of those great people, and that's why these stalkers turned into vegetables. As for Puma, I needed him to eliminate the only witness — you.
Well, thanks for the clarification. How did you survive?
My helmet, kiddo. That's the key to not joining them.
How did you plan on moving it? I saw what you were building. Thing's a leviathan.
What's it matter? And here's my question to you: what comes next?
I think the answer is obvious. You don't want me around now that I've seen what you've done. I also have no reason to trust you after I turn my back — you might just put a bullet in me.

Alright. You'll leave and smash that thing to pieces so no one else gets hurt. Not even that, you'll tear it apart under my watch. I'll keep your secret because I'm not looking for any trouble, but if I see you again, everyone will know who you are. Believe me, I have friends who will tell if anything happens to me. Understand?
I know everything I need to. I've already smashed your emitter to pieces, so now we'll go our own ways peacefully. If I ever meet you again, I'll shoot you where you stand.
Shit...
What's the matter? Be happy you're alive! Anyone else would've gunned you down a long time ago! Now let's split. We never saw each other.
What are you looking at?
Hey, what do you want?
Stay out of the way, monkey!
Keep a straight face, it makes you want to piss on her.
How long have you been peeing boiling water? Never? Then you will, you defective, if you don't get out of my sight now.
